result.execSummary:
The defendant Shauna M. Rigney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 33 days, if revoked.
Court will not suspend the def's DL.
Accepted into Drug Court Program.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Accepted into Drug Court Program.  Will not suspend DL.

timeConds.notes:
No Huber allowed.
Concurrent to 15CF109.
To complete the Living Free Program.
**Court STAYS the conditional jail time effective 12/10/15; Deft to be released 12/10/15.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION HAS BEEN REVOKED.  CONCURRENT to 15CF109.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*  Pay restitution plus surcharges.
May not have contact with Victims, unless otherwise permitted by the agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.
ALL UNPAID COURT COSTS ARE STILL DUE.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION HAS BEEN REVOKED.  CONCURRENT to Ct.1 and 15CF109.

superMiscConds.notes: ALL UNPAID COURT COSTS ARE STILL DUE.

Defendant Shauna M. Rigney appeared with Attorney Matthew J. Perz.  Defendant in custody.  Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: JM.
MINUTES:  Sentence:
Cts 1 & 2:  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 4 years w/conditions.  33 days sentence credit if revoked.  As a condition of probation the court imposed 6 months KCJ without hub priv's, forthwith, concurrent to 15CF109, as to complete the Living Free Program.  Court costs ordered.  Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant.  No restitution requested.  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.  Court will not suspend def's DL.  Appeal rights given.  Def. is accepted into Drug Court Program.
